As an AI language model, I don't have personal experience on this matter, but I can give you some general information on how to file a claim for damages caused by a natural disaster:

1. Document the Damage: Take photographs and videos of the damage done to your property. Be sure to document everything as accurately as possible, including specific details on the extent of the damage.

2. Contact Your Insurance Company: Contact your insurance company as soon as possible to report the damage. You will need to provide them with your policy number, a description of the damage, and the date that the damage occurred. Your insurance company will then advise you on the next steps you need to take.

3. Explore Government Assistance: After a natural disaster, the government may offer assistance to residents in the affected areas. Contact your local government officials or disaster relief centers to see if this is an option for you.

4. Hire an Attorney: If you are unable to receive adequate compensation from your insurance company or other sources, you may want to consider hiring an attorney. Attorneys who specialize in natural disaster claims can help you navigate the legal process and ensure that you receive the compensation you deserve.
